dublinCore.dc:title: 113 S2723 IS: Housing for Homeless Students Act of 2014
dublinCore.dc:rights: Pursuant to Title 17 Section 105 of the United States Code, this file is not subject to copyright protection and is in the public domain.

form.current-chamber: IN THE SENATE OF THE UNITED STATES

action.action-desc: Mr. Franken (for himself, Mr. Portman, Mrs. Murray, and Ms. Collins) introduced the following bill; which was read twice and referred to the Committee on Finance

form.official-title: To amend the Internal Revenue Code of 1986 to qualify homeless youth and veterans who are full-time students for purposes of the low income housing tax credit.

section.text:
This Act may be cited as the
Housing for Homeless Students Act of 2014
.

section.header: Homeless youth and veterans who are full-time students qualified for purposes of the low income housing tax credit

subsection.text: Clause (i) of section 42(i)(3)(D) of the Internal Revenue Code of 1986 is amended by redesignating subclauses (II) and (III) as subclauses (IV) and (V), respectively, and by inserting after subclause (I) the following new subclauses:

subclause.text: a full-time student who, during any portion of the 5-year period ending with the commencement of such individual's continuous occupation of any low-income unit or units, was an individual described in section 725(2) of the McKinney-Vento Homeless Assistance Act ( 42 U.S.C. 11434a ),

a full-time student who, during any portion of the 5-year period ending with the commencement of such individual's continuous occupation of any low-income unit or units, was an individual described in section 2002(1) of title 38, United States Code,

subsection.text: The amendments made by subsection (a) shall apply to determinations made before, on, or after the date of the enactment of this Act.
